repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: If one is using MSVC on Windows and inserting "/openmp" in the extra_link_args option, then one will receive an unnecessary warning. It's only necessary to include "-fopenmp" when using gcc.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option. Don't add any OpenMP flags to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option.
```

I've just tried to make it a little more concise here.

Thanks a lot for the advice - it's very useful to know!
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@ enable OpenMP.  For gcc this can be done as follows in a ``setup.py``:
 
         .. literalinclude:: ../../examples/userguide/parallelism/setup_pyx.py
 
-For Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'``.
+For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, the correct flag is ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option, and you should not pass either of the arguments ``'/openmp'`` or ``'-fopenmp'`` to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option to prevent an unnecessary warning.

comment_data.body: Thank you for the clarification. To make it even clearer, I recommend emphasizing that the specific flag "/openmp" should not be added to extra_link_args. However, it's possible that other flags might still be required.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@ enable OpenMP.  For gcc this can be done as follows in a ``setup.py``:
 
         .. literalinclude:: ../../examples/userguide/parallelism/setup_pyx.py
 
-For Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'``.
+For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, the correct flag is ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option, and you should not pass either of the arguments ``'/openmp'`` or ``'-fopenmp'`` to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option to prevent an unnecessary warning.

comment_data.body: I've gone back and edited my suggestion to "no need to add an OpenMP flag"
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@ enable OpenMP.  For gcc this can be done as follows in a ``setup.py``:
 
         .. literalinclude:: ../../examples/userguide/parallelism/setup_pyx.py
 
-For Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'``.
+For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, the correct flag is ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option, and you should not pass either of the arguments ``'/openmp'`` or ``'-fopenmp'`` to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option to prevent an unnecessary warning.

comment_data.body: Thanks! By mistake you wrote 'flags' and not 'flag'. Maybe we should emphasize it's not about there not being a need only, but also to avoid compile warnings.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@ enable OpenMP.  For gcc this can be done as follows in a ``setup.py``:
 
         .. literalinclude:: ../../examples/userguide/parallelism/setup_pyx.py
 
-For Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'``.
+For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, the correct flag is ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option, and you should not pass either of the arguments ``'/openmp'`` or ``'-fopenmp'`` to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option to prevent an unnecessary warning.

comment_data.body:
I think I meant "any" instead of "an". I've updated my suggestions just to say "Don't" rather than "No need".

I still prefer less text rather than more - we can give a simple instruction here and anything else seems unnecessary to me
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,7 @@ enable OpenMP.  For gcc this can be done as follows in a ``setup.py``:
 
         .. literalinclude:: ../../examples/userguide/parallelism/setup_pyx.py
 
-For Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, use ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'``.
+For the Microsoft Visual C++ compiler, the correct flag is ``'/openmp'`` instead of ``'-fopenmp'`` for the ``'extra_compile_args'`` option, and you should not pass either of the arguments ``'/openmp'`` or ``'-fopenmp'`` to the ``'extra_link_args'`` option to prevent an unnecessary warning.

commit.message:
Update description of flags used for MSVC

Make extra_link_args empty for MSVC to avoid warning.
